newsitem.title: UK: Rugby says pleased with current trade so far.
newsitem.headline: Rugby says pleased with current trade so far.

text.p: British construction company Rugby Group Plc said on Friday it was so far pleased with its overall progress in the current year.
"Despite a mixed picture for UK construction markets, cement volumes are encouragingly higher, helped by the mild winter," the group's chairman Robin Gourlay told the annual meeting of shareholders.
Gourlay said building activity remained at a low level in Australia but improvements in Stegbar had resulted in better financial performance.
"Cockburn's new kiln is being commissioned and trading results are on plan," he said.
The group also made a good start in the U.S. due to milder weather and stable market conditions.
"...And in continental Europe our joinery businesses continue on target," the chairman said.
